column2: French: Aéroport International Martinique Aimé Césaire (IATA: FDF
column4: is the international airport of Martinique in the French West Indies. Located in Le Lamentin
column5: a suburb of the capital Fort-de-France
column6: it was opened in 1950 and renamed in 2007
column7: after author and politician Aimé Césaire.

column1: The airport is at an elevation of 16 ft (5 m) above mean sea level. It has one runway designated 10/28 with an asphalt surface measuring 3
column3: 843 ft × 148 ft). When Air Martinique existed
column4: its headquarters was located on the airport property. The runway is of a length that can accommodate large jets
column5: including 747s from France. On at least two occasions
column6: the Concorde flew from Paris and landed at the airport in Martinique.Passenger facilities include police
column25: and two hotels (Hôtel La Galléria and Hôtel Valmenière).
